paragraph.paragraph: The simplest way to deploy EiffelEnvision projects is through the use of the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects available in the Enterprise, or better, editions of Visual Studio .NET 2003. EiffelEnvision integrates tightly into the deployment mechanism provided by the Visual Studio .NET IDE, providing a fast and easy way to package and distribute your projects.

Before attempting to deploy EiffelEnvision projects using the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects, please be sure to read the deploy_setup.xmldeployment prerequisites section of this documentation.

For those with the Standard edition of Visual Studio .NET 2003, or those who do not want to use the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects, please refer to deploy_no_setup.xmldeploying projects outside of Visual Studio .NET for information of deploying EiffelEnvision projects without using the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects.

To begin deploying EiffelEnvision projects using one of the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects, you should be familiar with ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vboriDeploymentInVisualStudio.htmdeploying projects using Visual Studio .NET 2003. A knowledge of ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconWhatYouNeedToKnowAboutMicrosoftWindowsInstaller.htmMicrosoft Windows Installer will also help greatly when it comes to finer grained customization of your deployment project.

If you have not already done so, you will need to ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconCreatingOrAddingDeploymentProjects.htmcreate a deployment project using the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfNewProjectDialog.htmnew project dialog.

When using a ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment project, the primary way to include the built results of a project is through ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconaddingitemstodeploymentproject.htmadding a project output to the deployment project. EiffelEnvision projects define 4 different project outputs for inclusion in your deployment project.
Primary Output
Debug Symbols
Content Files
Source FilesPrimary Output The result of compilation. This will be the file containing an assembly manifest as well as reference assembly modules. Debug Symbols Any generated ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsdebug/html/_core_The_..PDB_Files.htmdebugging information database files (*.PDB) generated during compilation. PDB files are only generated when the active project configuration's ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/debugging.xmlgenerate_debug_informationGenerate Debug Information is set to Yes. Content Files Files located in the project that are considered to be content files. Such files include Bitmaps, Icons, Cursors, etc. Source Files Contains all of the project source files found at the project location or in any of its subfolders.

It may be necessary to exclude certain files when adding items to the deployment project using a project output. For information on how to do this using ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmsetup and deployment projects, please refer to ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbtskexcludingitemsfromdeploymentproject.htmexcluding files from a project output group.

Once you have configured your deployment project, all that remains is to ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmbuild it. If you have not already built your EiffelEnvision project(s), selecting to ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskprepareandmanagebuilds.htmbuild the deployment project will also build the EiffelEnvision project(s) in the same build session.

If you require to deploy you project source files, you will simply need to include all of the files and subfolders located in the project folder, with the exception of the bin and obj folders. All paths stored in an EiffelEnvision project file are relative to the project location, making the project portable. EiffelEnvision also permits the use of ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/environment_variables.xmlEnvironment Variables in all paths, making the project even more portable than projects created for other languages in Visual Studio .NET.
